by Gloria Gayner

[ch]E7[/ch]

           [ch]Esus4[/ch]                 [ch]E[/ch]

               [ch]Am[/ch]               [ch]Dm[/ch]
But now you're back, from outer space,
              [ch]G[/ch]                                   [ch]Cmaj7[/ch]
I just walked in, to find you here, with that sad look upon your face.
              [ch]Fmaj7[/ch]
I should have changed that stupid lock,
              [ch]Bm7b5[/ch]
I should have made you leave your key,
         [ch]Esus4[/ch]                               [ch]E[/ch]
If I had known for just one second, you'd be back to bother me.


[Chorus]

           [ch]Am[/ch]               [ch]Dm[/ch]
Go on now, go; walk out the door;
            [ch]G[/ch]                          [ch]Cmaj7[/ch]
Just turn a-round now, 'cos you're not welcome any more.
[ch]Fmaj7[/ch]                             [ch]Bm7b5[/ch]
 Weren't you the one who tried to hurt me with goodbye?
                  [ch]Esus4[/ch]                      [ch]E[/ch]
Did you think I'd crumble; did you think I'd lay down and die?
           [ch]Am[/ch]            [ch]Dm[/ch]
Oh no, not I; I will sur-vive,
       [ch]G[/ch]                             [ch]Cmaj7[/ch]
Oh, as long as I know how to love, I know I'll stay alive.
         [ch]Fmaj7[/ch]                             [ch]Bm7b5[/ch]
I've got all my life to live, and I've got all my love to give,
             [ch]Esus4[/ch]            [ch]E[/ch]                [ch]Am[/ch] 
And I'll sur-vive, I will sur-vive, I will sur-vive...


[Interlude]

[ch]Am[/ch]  [ch]Dm[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]  [ch]Cmaj7[/ch]  [ch]Fmaj7[/ch]  [ch]Bm7b5[/ch]  [ch]Esus4[/ch]  [ch]E[/ch]

              [ch]Esus4[/ch]                          [ch]E[/ch]

[Chorus]

           [ch]Am[/ch]               [ch]Dm[/ch]

            [ch]G[/ch]                          [ch]Cmaj7[/ch]

              [ch]D7[/ch]                  [ch]G[/ch]

         [ch]G[/ch]

      [ch]Am[/ch]             [ch]D7[/ch]          [ch]G[/ch]

Who cupped hands around the tin cans

That you're waving' from the back roads
By the rivers of my memory
Ever smiling never changes on my mind

Song: Gentle on my mind
Artist: Glen Campbell
Composer: John Hartford
Album: Gentle on my mind

Tabbed by DJ ('DiddyD' on ultimateGuitar.com)
26th May 2017

CAPO: 1st fret (Will then sound in the recorded key of Eb)

To add more interest pick an alternating bass pattern on the
4th & 5th strings. On the D chords alternate with a D to A
bass note, on the Em chords alternate with an E to B bass note,
and on the A7 alternate an A to E bass note.

Chord names and fret positions are relative to the capo:
[ch]D[/ch]     = xx0232   [ch]Em[/ch]   = 022000

                 [ch]A7[/ch]   = x02020

...by for - gotten words and bonds,

That keeps you in the backroads,
         [ch]Em7[/ch]          [ch]A7[/ch]
By the rivers of my memory,
    [ch]Em7[/ch]             [ch]A7[/ch]          [ch]D[/ch]
It keeps you ever gentle on my mind!

[Verse 2]
           [ch]D[/ch]             [ch]Dmaj7[/ch]

[Verse 3]
